steps.name: Start
01. Is this a Type A or a Type B, Modification or Software Change?
02. Allocate Design Change Owner
03. Initiate Project.
04. Check / validate assumptions, risks and mitigations against initial estimates.
05. Consider Learning from Experience (LFE) and other factors that will affect feasibility of Option or Design Solution.
06. Initiate Design Change Management Form (DCMF)
07. Will a User Requirements Document / System Requirements Document be produced?
08. Produce the User Requirements
09. Initiate Design Change Management Form (DCMF)
10. Allocate lead areas for phases.
11. Conduct Design or Feasibility Studies as necessary.
12. Produce Outline Design Solution as necessary.
13. Functional Design Study options analysed from a Systems perspective.
14. Produce Detailed System Design.
15. Produce and raise Schedule
16. Consider impact of change on wider change programme.
17. Estimate costs of any related changes that will be required as a direct result of this change
18. Conduct Technical Studies to inform the production of the System Requirements.
19. Conduct Feasibility Studies to inform the production of the System Requirements
20. Will external support be required?
21. Estimate cost of external support
22. Outline fitting opportunities identified.
23. High level costings for Assessment phase activities established.
24. Produce and prosecute Initial Gate Business Case to approval.
25. Produce the Draft System Requirements
26. Review Margins Estimations.
27. Update / Set Margin.
28. Design Change Owner (DCO) advised on Functional Design requirements, scheduling and costings considerations.
29. Undertake Functional Design Studies in support of highlighted risks and assumptions; including Preliminary System Design Options and Technical (Options) Analysis.
30. Functional Design Study options analysed from a Systems perspective.
31. Produce Detailed System Design.
32. Update System Requirements ready for dissemination
33. Produce and Issue Schedule
34. Update the User Requirements (if required).
35. Update high level impacts of maturing Design Solution.
36. All technical and cost information compiled and presented for review.
37. Proceed with Change Development.
38. Design Change Owner (DCO) receives Design Change Initial Gate feedback.
39. Sign DCMF supported by the Design Change focal point.
40. Capability Sponsor notified.
41. Record decision in DCMF.
42. Issue final version of the System Requirements (if applicable).
43. Produce and prosecute Main Gate Business Case to approval (if applicable).
44. Continue design change development.
END
